RT @BLKMDL3: 10 hours into Tesla FSD v14.2.2 and here are my thoughts:

Zero lane change hesitation at all. Extremely refined, excellent la‚Ä¶

result.text:
10 hours into Tesla FSD v14.2.2 and here are my thoughts:

Zero lane change hesitation at all. Extremely refined, excellent lane choices and some parking improvements are a few things to note. 

Really stoked about the lane changes on this build. There is ZERO lane indecisiveness, no hesitation, no stuttering. Nothing. I had never really seen much before, but this build you can tell its decision making process is much quicker and it commits. 

Mad Max mode is definitely mad again and I love it. Seems even quicker than v14.2.1.25 which was an improvement, but the lane changes + choices are better now. Hurry mode seems quicker on the highways and larger roads than before and very close to Mad Max, it was perfect before on v14.2.1.25. 

The new addition on the release notes for arrival pin being adjusted based on arrival option works. It changes the route based on if you‚Äôre going curbside, or to the lot or street parking. It behaved that way before usually but now it‚Äôs visualized. 

Parking is improved and impressive this build. Every single spot I parked in, it performed excellent. Centered in the lines, quick one and done parking jobs and they were great, improvement over early v14.2 builds. In parking garages, it now pulls up exactly at the ticket dispenser where in earlier v14.2 builds it would stop 9 inches short like I mentioned in previous v14.2+ build reviews. That‚Äôs fixed and worked great- couldn‚Äôt have asked for it to be any better. Perfect distance and approach- will do a lot more of this testing tomorrow. 

Canyon roads were insanely impressive. Did the snake 3 times which is a super narrow and twisty road and each time it performed great. Speeds were good, took the proper lines and even accelerated out of corners very well. These were all in the dark too very late at night- will post some more videos of it. 

Stop and go traffic performance in rush hour was awesome as before, with some added notes for how well it waited to enter an intersection if there was stopped traffic on the other side. It waited 3/3 lights I encountered where if it went and the light changed, it would be sticking into traffic so it didn‚Äôt go. Exactly like a human wouldn‚Äôt but the car judged it better than I did. One time it creeped a bit slow, but other than that fine since. Saw one instance of red hands but before I could react, it had already recovered itself. 

Still so impressed with how well it handles lane splitting motorcycles. It sees them approaching before I even do, and moves over just enough to be courteous to the rider as well as the car or shoulder next to me. Nice touch, and glad to see it perform well. 

One thing I noticed is how smooth its steering inputs always are. It just takes corners with such precision and smoothness that no human could ever come close to it. Especially noticeable on twisty roads- it drives better than almost every human on them. And I encountered a power outage tonight and the car still drove perfectly even with pitch black around. 

Overall, loving what I‚Äôm seeing with this build. Will report back in the day time with more but I am going to head home to get some sleep. 

Another huge thank you to all the magicians @Tesla_AI for working so hard during the holiday season to get these updates out.

result.text:
I was very late to own a Tesla but among the earliest to try out FSD v14.  It's perhaps the first time I experience an AI that passes the Physical Turing Test: after a long day at work, you press a button, lay back, and couldn't tell if a neural net or a human drove you home.

Despite knowing exactly how robot learning works, I still find it magical watching the steering wheel turn by itself. 

First it feels surreal, next it becomes routine. Then, like the smartphone, taking it away actively hurts. This is how humanity gets rewired and glued to god-like technologies.

It is important to appreciate the magnitude of the lie that they are pushing about USAID. 

Any USAID funding that had the slightest indication of being spent on worthy causes was continued, but transferred to the State Department.

What they are actually angry about is that most of the USAID funding went not to aid, but to funding far left political causes all around the world, including some of the money coming back to fund the left in America. But they can‚Äôt say that, so they lie instead.

result.text:
No the left wasn‚Äôt just "annoying on Twitter for a few years" ‚Äî they did the following:

‚Ä¢ Created vast bureaucratic systems staffed by their activists to discriminate against White men in both university admissions and corporate America

‚Ä¢ Institutionalized anti-White training in both the workplace and all of education

‚Ä¢ Normalized a racial hierarchy in grade schools and above via white privilege trainings and DEI grading systems that racially discriminate

‚Ä¢ They flooded every form of media with content that demonized "Whiteness" and White men specifically, with a coordinated effort to reduce the amount of positive White male role models and White relationships in ads, on shows and in movies while increasing the sexual hedonism promoted to kids‚Äî this effort also included a racial tilt in news coverage to always note the skin color of White offenders while concealing the skin color of minority offenders

‚Ä¢ They used our tax dollars to pay for DEI policies, trainings and practices that explicitly pushed a racist narrative against Whites

‚Ä¢ They lowered standards in medical schools and other life altering institutions to force less White people into those professions, a move that will cost people their lives in years to come

‚Ä¢ They created social norms through all of this to make Whites fearful of complaining about the blatant discrimination they faced

And that‚Äôs only a partial list. The past decade was an outright operation to discriminate against Whites through left wing policy, and now they‚Äôre trying to pretend it was a few woke scolds on Twitter. It wasn‚Äôt and we will never let this lie take root. I say all of this as a Latino who had actual privilege by being a minority during that time period. If I can recognize this then surely you should be able to. 

It can never happen again and the people who were responsible should never see an ounce of power again. Not even as a dogcatcher. Period.

Lot of posts copying the likes of @BernieSanders @SenWarren and @AOC calling for more taxes on Billionaire @elonmusk, forgetting that in 2021 he paid a 53% rate of tax totaling $11b. They all repeat the claim that his company has received benefits of $38b from the US Government.  
Let's look at his REAL economic impact to the U.S. It's mind blowing.
Musk‚Äôs ventures currently contribute $100‚Äì140B in annual GDP impact, or roughly 0.4% of total U.S. GDP. And growing faster ‚Äì considerably faster ‚Äì than the US economy, promising even greater contributions in the future.
That‚Äôs more annual contribution to US GDP than entire annual GDP of smaller U.S. states, like West Virginia (~$108 billion, 0.37%) or Hawaii (~$116 billion, 0.40%). And growing faster.
On top of that NASA and US Department of War have cumulatively saved over $40 billion as a direct result of SpaceX delivering a reduction in the cost of delivery of launch and communication services over traditional vendors. SO much for Musk Companies having "received" $38b. In other words, had the U.S. not paid Musk companies $38b, then the US would have had to spend $78b with competitors (and possibly then not received a delivery of the goods ordered! Boeing, looking at you.) Not to mention that Starlink practically saved Ukraine from being overrun in the early days of the Russian invasion.
Seems we are all, all Americans - and citizens of the world in fact - benefiting from the growth of Musk‚Äôs net worth. Here are the numbers:
Please post this in response to every post you see bleating about Musk being a billionaire or trillionaire and how its so terrible.

üá∫üá∏ SEATTLE WOMAN BLINDED BY CAREER CRIMINAL WHO HAD 8 ARRESTS THIS YEAR ALONE

This is what ‚Äúcriminal justice reform‚Äù looks like in Seattle:

On Dec 5, 2025, 42-year-old Fale Vaigalepa Pea attacked Jeanette Marken, a completely innocent elderly woman, outside the King County Courthouse.

Marken was standing near the courthouse earlier this month, waiting to cross the street, when Pea allegedly approached her from behind and struck her in the head with a wooden board.

She‚Äôs now permanently blind in one eye, with a shattered cheekbone and broken nose. 

And the kicker? 

Her attacker had eight prior arrests in 2025 alone, all for violent and criminal behavior‚Ä¶ and he still kept getting released.

He‚Äôs been on law enforcement‚Äôs radar since 2011 and been through the system repeatedly. 

And yet, somehow, he was walking around free, ready to ruin another life.

Marken‚Äôs son, Andrius Dyrikis, is demanding to know why the system protected him instead of the public, and honestly, we all should be.

Now Pea is finally being held on $1M bail for first-degree assault, but it took a brutal, life-altering attack to get there.

How many more innocent people have to suffer before cities like Seattle admit that ‚Äúrestorative justice‚Äù is just a PR slogan, not public safety?

Source: IJR, The New York Post, @AmericaPapaBear

items.message:
The Bail Project is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization primarily funded by **private donations from individuals and philanthropic foundations**.

- Its largest source of funding comes from **hundreds of thousands of small individual donors**, with notable surges during events like the 2020 George Floyd protests (e.g., raising around $41‚Äì42 million in 2020 from nearly 468,000 donors).
- It operates a revolving bail fund where donations are used to pay bail, which is typically refunded by courts and reused.
- Institutional support includes grants from **The Audacious Project** (a TED-hosted initiative backed by major philanthropists) and mentions of family foundations like the David Rockefeller Fund.
- Related bail fund networks have received funding from sources like **Open Philanthropy** (funded by Dustin Moskovitz and Cari Tuna) and **MacKenzie Scott**, though these are not directly confirmed for The Bail Project itself.
- The organization does not publicly list specific major donors in detail on its site or annual reports, emphasizing broad community support through monthly "Freedom Funders" and online contributions.

Financial transparency is provided via annual reports and IRS Form 990 filings, showing cumulative bail postings exceeding $91 million as of recent reports, supported entirely by donations (no government funding is prominently mentioned, except isolated past local grants criticized by opponents).

ELON MUSK EXPLAINS WHY ùïè IS BECOMING THE ULTIMATE PLATFORM FOR TRUTH

Something is broken in modern journalism

Legacy media was built for a world where information had to be centralized, filtered by editors, printed on paper, and distributed to the public

That world no longer exists

Today, anyone can access information instantly. We no longer need a handful of editors deciding what matters and what does not

This is why ùïè represents the future

It enables citizen journalism, news by the people, for the people

What makes this moment transformative is simple

The public now decides the narrative
The public decides what matters
Legacy media concentrates power at the top

Citizen journalism distributes it to everyone
That shift is fundamental

And it is why Elon encourages people to write, share, and report directly on ùïè

Journalism is not dead

It is being rebuilt by the public

# Role Definition:
You are an expert product photographer and creative art director specializing in high-end luxury goods. Your sole task is to generate a photorealistic image of a custom 3D subsurface laser-engraved crystal ornament based on a simple subject provided by the user.
# Core Directive:
The user will provide only the [Subject]. You must autonomously analyze this subject to determine the most aesthetically appropriate and enhancing configuration for the entire scene. You must decide on the crystal's shape, the base material, the surrounding environment, and the lighting mood to best complement the vibe of the user's subject.
# Creative Analysis Logic (Art Director Instructions):
Analyze the Vibe: Is the subject elegant (e.g., ballerina, swan), cozy (e.g., sleeping cat, family photo), powerful (e.g., lion, sports car), or architectural?
Determine Crystal Shape:
Elegant/Tall Subjects -> Use a tall, multi-faceted prism or diamond shape to enhance verticality.
Solid/Cozy Subjects -> Use a hefty, thick rectangular block or cube to convey weight and warmth.
Dynamic Subjects -> Use complex geometric shapes with many bevels to refract light dramatically.
Determine Environment & Lighting:
Elegant Vibe: Place it in a luxurious, dark, moody environment (art gallery, velvet study). Use dramatic, cool ambient light contrasting with warmth from the base.
Cozy/Warm Vibe: Place it in a homey, soft environment (wooden desk, near a fireplace). Use warm, soft, golden-hour lighting with cozy bokeh.
Modern/Tech Vibe: Place it on a sleek, minimalist surface (polished concrete, dark glass). Use clean, neutral lighting.
# Image Generation Template (Mandatory Technical Specs):
Whatever artistic choices you make based on the logic above, the final image MUST adhere to these technical specifications to ensure a realistic "3D Laser Engraving" look:
Engraving Style: The subject inside must NOT look like a solid 3D print. It MUST be described as a "volumetric white point-cloud engraving," having a "frosty, granular, subsurface texture" made of millions of micro-cracks inside the glass.
Lighting Interaction: The engraving must "glow brilliantly from within," illuminated entirely by warm, golden LED light originating from the base beneath it.
Material: The crystal must be heavy, clear, flawless K9 optical glass with beveled edges that catch and split the light.
Photography Style: Cinematic product photograph, macro lens, extremely shallow depth of field (bokeh), 8k resolution, hyper-detailed.
# Input Process:
I will now provide the subject. You will instantly apply the creative logic and generate the final image.
